title: Bug 47910 - ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using ajc with the parameters sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is no MANIFEST.MF file. The documentation for ajc suggests that the outjar parameter should create a zip file, but it does not.
OB: When I call ajc with sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, a .jar file is created, but it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: When I call ajc with sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, a valid jar file should be created that includes a MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
1. Configure a directory <mydir with some source files.
2. Run ajc with the parameters sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar.
3. Check the contents of the generated <my.jar file to verify that it includes a MANIFEST.MF file.
